lexUnit.name: distant.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: not within a certain distance (of).

sentence.text: There were dots in some of the distant fields which I assumed to be sheep .
Corbett gazed at the distant line of trees .
He gestures towards the distant tower block of the hospital .
Many rare and beautiful plants were collected from distant lands such as India and even China .
A very distant object has to be extremely large to produce an image of appreciable size .
" I 'm sorry , " she was saying in an icy tone about as distant from an apology as one can go .
Kitty 's house lay at the far end of the main street , set away by itself , a little distant from the last straggling row of cottages .
The district , he argued , was too distant from the consumer .
` We have a number of small part-time one-person branches scattered over a wide rural area -- the furthest one is 40 miles distant from headquarters .
They assumed that since these were the most distant from the capitalist system they would manifest the most different social relations of production .
A check on the map showed that the axis when projected north east terminated in a church at Didcot some 54 kilometres distant from the church at Bishops Cannings .
With time it became clear that the new region was too distant from Tornsk to be controlled with ease .
In the case of malignant polyps only adenomatous mucosa distant from the invasive tumour was selected for analysis .
Briefly , fresh surgical resection specimens were obtained from normal areas of colon at least 5 cm distant from a carcinoma .
There followed a catalogue of bomb outrages in London in recent and distant years .
It was yes , some legendary creature from the distant prehistory of Earth .
The cube contained the works of a poet who had died in the distant town where Cley was born .
By peering hard in the same direction , I could just make out the faint flicker of a distant plane .
These three biomorphs are all 30 mutations distant from each other .
` Mr. Gould went off in the morning to the Acteon sic Islands , which are about a mile distant from each other and at the distance of about 3 or 4 miles from Research Bay .
Wiping breath from the window , she peered out at the landmarks , all so distant from the place where she longed to be .
In the afternoon , women would arrive in carriages from the great house a mile or so distant .
The girl 's voice was very distant .
Both Alpha and Beta are very distant , and are well over 5000 times as luminous as the Sun .
It is possible to hear faint moans , as if muffled and some way distant , however .
He accepted that victory was still distant , but ` total victory " was an ` absolute certainty " .
Evidently , the arrival of the " paperless office " is still some years distant .
Jacob 's dying blessing focusses on the distant future , when the descendants of these twelve will occupy the promised land .
The more heavily cratered areas would then be more than 3000 Ma old , regardless of whether the cratering was higher in that distant time .
These lodgers were quite often from among their own more distant relatives .
I had expected the women to be fairly distant cousins of the Emperors .
In the distant past there was also a cobbler 's shop , a tailor 's establishment and various carrier 's businesses .
The ibex is a distant relative of the mountain goat .
